answers.author: Stephen Driscoll
answers.text:
The City of Sparks, Nevada requires graduate and prefers post-graduate degrees for all of its senior staff positions and the requirements are noted in the job classification descriptions (see our website www.cityofsparks.us) . The requirement is a screening  factor during the hiring process.
In the past incumbants and applicants were allowed to substitute time and experience for actual completed education requirements. To encourage incumbants to further their formal edcuation, the city provides education reimbursement on an annual basis to assist in the cost of tuition and books. Currently, the city's share is minimual but provides something and is being utilized by personnel at various levels within the organization currently.

Steve – I hope the following is helpful:
Knoxville, TN – Tuition Refund Benefit
Doesn’t specific who is eligible so I assume it’s available to all employees
http://www.cityofknoxville.org/benefits/other/default.asp 
Tempe, AZ – Tuition & Book Reimbursement
“All full time employees who have completed their original probation period” (Page 2)
http://www.tempe.gov/modules/showdocument.aspx?documentid=9146 
Austin, TX – Tuition Reimbursment 
“Regular employees in budgeted positions working at least 30 hours per week are eligible for 
up to the annual maximum reimbursement of $2,000 per fiscal year.” (Page 4)
http://austintexas.gov/sites/default/files/files/HR/tuitre20.pdf 
Scottsdale, AZ – Tuition Reimbursement Eligibility
http://www.scottsdaleaz.gov/HR/benefacts/tuition 
Milwaukee, MI – Tuition Refund Benefit
“he amount of tuition available depends upon the particular union or employee group to which an employee belong”
http://city.milwaukee.gov/der/TuitionBenefit

author: Steven Gillespie
text:
Hi Everyone,,
I hope all is well.  Quick question for the group, does anyone have any knowledge of any white papers or professional associations that have adopted a position / policy speaking to an organization providing educational support for non-bargaining unit (executive management) members who want to purse an advanced degree (graduate / post-graduate)?  Thank you in advance.
Again, hope all is well!
Cheers,
Steven Gillespie, Ed.D.
title: Higher Education for Executive Level Public Employees
